verses.text: Then go out to the valley of Ben-hinnom, which is by the entrance of the potsherd gate, and proclaim there the words that I tell you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Behold I am about to bring a calamity upon this place, at which the ears of everyone that hears of it will tingle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they have forsaken Me and have made this an alien place and have burned sacrifices in it to other gods, that neither they nor their forefathers nor the kings of Judah had ever known, and because they have filled this place with the blood of the innocent
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have built the high places of Baal to burn their sons in the fire as burnt offerings to Baal, a thing which I never commanded or spoke of, nor did it ever enter My mind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the valley of Ben-hinnom, but rather the valley of Slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make void the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem in this place, and I will cause them to fall by the sword before their enemies and by the hand of those who seek their life; and I will give over their carcasses as food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also make this city a desolation and an object of hissing; everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss because of all its disasters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they will eat one another’s flesh in the siege and in the distress with which their enemies and those who seek their life will distress them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you are to break the jar in the sight of the men who accompany you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, “Just so will I break this people and this city, even as one breaks a potter’s vessel, which cannot again be repaired; and they will bury in Topheth because there is no other place for burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how I will treat this place and its inhabitants,” declares the Lord, “so as to make this city like Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will be defiled like the place Topheth, because of all the houses on whose rooftops they burned sacrifices to all the heavenly host and poured out drink offerings to other gods.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy; and he stood in the court of the Lord’s house and said to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Behold, I am about to bring on this city and all its towns the entire calamity that I have declared against it, because they have stiffened their necks so as not to heed My words.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pashhur the priest, the son of Immer, who was chief officer in the house of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pashhur had Jeremiah the prophet beaten and put him in the stocks that were at the upper Benjamin Gate, which was by the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, when Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “Pashhur is not the name the Lord has called you, but rather Magor-missabib.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, ‘Behold, I am going to make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends; and while your eyes look on, they will fall by the sword of their enemies. So I will give over all Judah to the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will carry them away as exiles to Babylon and will slay them with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also give over all the wealth of this city, all its produce and all its costly things; even all the treasures of the kings of Judah I will give over to the hand of their enemies, and they will plunder them, take them away and bring them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Pashhur, and all who live in your house will go into captivity; and you will enter Babylon, and there you will die and there you will be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have falsely prophesied.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For each time I speak, I cry aloud;
I proclaim violence and destruction,
Because for me the word of the Lord has resulted
In reproach and derision all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if I say, “I will not remember Him
Or speak anymore in His name,”
Then in my heart it becomes like a burning fire
Shut up in my bones;
And I am weary of holding it in,
And I cannot endure it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I have heard the whispering of many,
“Terror on every side!
Denounce him; yes, let us denounce him!”
All my trusted friends,
Watching for my fall, say:
“Perhaps he will be deceived, so that we may prevail against him
And take our revenge on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is with me like a dread champion;
Therefore my persecutors will stumble and not prevail.
They will be utterly ashamed, because they have failed,
With an everlasting disgrace that will not be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, praise the Lord!
For He has delivered the soul of the needy one
From the hand of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the day when I was born;
Let the day not be blessed when my mother bore me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the man who brought the news
To my father, saying,
“A baby boy has been born to you!”
And made him very happy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But let that man be like the cities
Which the Lord overthrew without relenting,
And let him hear an outcry in the morning
And a shout of alarm at noon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he did not kill me before birth,
So that my mother would have been my grave,
And her womb ever pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I ever come forth from the womb
To look on trouble and sorrow,
So that my days have been spent in shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Malchijah, and Zephaniah the priest, the son of Maaseiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please inquire of the Lord on our behalf, for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is warring against us; perhaps the Lord will deal with us according to all His wonderful acts, so that the enemy will withdraw from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to them, “You shall say to Zedekiah as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel, “Behold, I am about to turn back the weapons of war which are in your hands, with which you are warring against the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside the wall; and I will gather them into the center of this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I Myself will war against you with an outstretched hand and a mighty arm, even in anger and wrath and great indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also strike down the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast; they will die of a great pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then afterwards,” declares the Lord, “I will give over Zedekiah king of Judah and his servants and the people, even those who survive in this city from the pestilence, the sword and the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their foes and into the hand of those who seek their lives; and he will strike them down with the edge of the sword. He will not spare them nor have pity nor compassion.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also say to this people, ‘Thus says the Lord, “Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who dwells in this city will die by the sword and by famine and by pestilence; but he who goes out and falls away to the Chaldeans who are besieging you will live, and he will have his own life as booty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have set My face against this city for harm and not for good,” declares the Lord. “It will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon and he will burn it with fire.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then say to the household of the king of Judah, ‘Hear the word of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of David, thus says the Lord:
“Administer justice every morning;
And deliver the person who has been robbed from the power of his oppressor,
That My wrath may not go forth like fire
And burn with none to extinguish it,
Because of the evil of their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, O valley dweller,
O rocky plain,” declares the Lord,
“You men who say, ‘Who will come down against us?
Or who will enter into our habitations?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I will punish you according to the results of your deeds,” declares the Lord,
“And I will kindle a fire in its forest
That it may devour all its environs.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, “Go down to the house of the king of Judah, and there speak this word
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, who sits on David’s throne, you and your servants and your people who enter these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, “Do justice and righteousness, and deliver the one who has been robbed from the power of his oppressor. Also do not mistreat or do violence to the stranger, the orphan, or the widow; and do not shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you men will indeed perform this thing, then kings will enter the gates of this house, sitting in David’s place on his throne, riding in chariots and on horses, even the king himself and his servants and his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not obey these words, I swear by Myself,” declares the Lord, “that this house will become a desolation.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord concerning the house of the king of Judah:
“You are like Gilead to Me,
Like the summit of Lebanon;
Yet most assuredly I will make you like a wilderness,
Like cities which are not inhabited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For I will set apart destroyers against you,
Each with his weapons;
And they will cut down your choicest cedars
And throw them on the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Many nations will pass by this city; and they will say to one another, ‘Why has the Lord done thus to this great city?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will answer, ‘Because they forsook the covenant of the Lord their God and bowed down to other gods and served them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not weep for the dead or mourn for him,
But weep continually for the one who goes away;
For he will never return
Or see his native land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord in regard to Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who became king in the place of Josiah his father, who went forth from this place, “He will never return there;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in the place where they led him captive, there he will die and not see this land again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who builds his house without righteousness
And his upper rooms without justice,
Who uses his neighbor’s services without pay
And does not give him his wages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who says, ‘I will build myself a roomy house
With spacious upper rooms,
And cut out its windows,
Paneling it with cedar and painting it bright red.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Do you become a king because you are competing in cedar?
Did not your father eat and drink
And do justice and righteousness?
Then it was well with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He pled the cause of the afflicted and needy;
Then it was well.
Is not that what it means to know Me?”
Declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But your eyes and your heart
Are intent only upon your own dishonest gain,
And on shedding innocent blood
And on practicing oppression and extortion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord in regard to Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah,
“They will not lament for him:
‘Alas, my brother!’ or, ‘Alas, sister!’
They will not lament for him:
‘Alas for the master!’ or, ‘Alas for his splendor!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He will be buried with a donkey’s burial,
Dragged off and thrown out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up to Lebanon and cry out,
And lift up your voice in Bashan;
Cry out also from Abarim,
For all your lovers have been crushed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I spoke to you in your prosperity;
But you said, ‘I will not listen!’
This has been your practice from your youth,
That you have not obeyed My voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The wind will sweep away all your shepherds,
And your lovers will go into captivity;
Then you will surely be ashamed and humiliated
Because of all your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You who dwell in Lebanon,
Nested in the cedars,
How you will groan when pangs come upon you,
Pain like a woman in childbirth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” declares the Lord, “even though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were a signet ring on My right hand, yet I would pull you off;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will give you over into the hand of those who are seeking your life, yes, into the hand of those whom you dread, even into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hurl you and your mother who bore you into another country where you were not born, and there you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for the land to which they desire to return, they will not return to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is this man Coniah a despised, shattered jar?
Or is he an undesirable vessel?
Why have he and his descendants been hurled out
And cast into a land that they had not known?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O land, land, land,
Hear the word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord,
‘Write this man down childless,
A man who will not prosper in his days;
For no man of his descendants will prosper
Sitting on the throne of David
Or ruling again in Judah.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of My pasture!” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God of Israel concerning the shepherds who are tending My people: “You have scattered My flock and driven them away, and have not attended to them; behold, I am about to attend to you for the evil of your deeds,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I Myself will gather the remnant of My flock out of all the countries where I have driven them and bring them back to their pasture, and they will be fruitful and multiply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also raise up shepherds over them and they will tend them; and they will not be afraid any longer, nor be terrified, nor will any be missing,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord,
“When I will raise up for David a righteous Branch;
And He will reign as king and act wisely
And do justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In His days Judah will be saved,
And Israel will dwell securely;
And this is His name by which He will be called,
‘The Lord our righteousness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when they will no longer say, ‘As the Lord lives, who brought up the sons of Israel from the land of Egypt,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but, ‘As the Lord lives, who brought up and led back the descendants of the household of Israel from the north land and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ Then they will live on their own soil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for the prophets:
My heart is broken within me,
All my bones tremble;
I have become like a drunken man,
Even like a man overcome with wine,
Because of the Lord
And because of His holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the land is full of adulterers;
For the land mourns because of the curse.
The pastures of the wilderness have dried up.
Their course also is evil
And their might is not right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For both prophet and priest are polluted;
Even in My house I have found their wickedness,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore their way will be like slippery paths to them,
They will be driven away into the gloom and fall down in it;
For I will bring calamity upon them,
The year of their punishment,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moreover, among the prophets of Samaria I saw an offensive thing:
They prophesied by Baal and led My people Israel astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Also among the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a horrible thing:
The committing of adultery and walking in falsehood;
And they strengthen the hands of evildoers,
So that no one has turned back from his wickedness.
All of them have become to Me like Sodom,
And her inhabitants like Gomorrah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the prophets,
‘Behold, I am going to feed them wormwood
And make them drink poisonous water,
For from the prophets of Jerusalem
Pollution has gone forth into all the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts,
“Do not listen to the words of the prophets who are prophesying to you.
They are leading you into futility;
They speak a vision of their own imagination,
Not from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They keep saying to those who despise Me,
‘The Lord has said, “You will have peace”’;
And as for everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart,
They say, ‘Calamity will not come upon you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But who has stood in the council of the Lord,
That he should see and hear His word?
Who has given heed to His word and listened?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I did not send these prophets,
But they ran.
I did not speak to them,
But they prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But if they had stood in My council,
Then they would have announced My words to My people,
And would have turned them back from their evil way
And from the evil of their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Am I a God who is near,” declares the Lord,
“And not a God far off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Can a man hide himself in hiding places
So I do not see him?” declares the Lord.
“Do I not fill the heavens and the earth?” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy falsely in My name, saying, ‘I had a dream, I had a dream!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long? Is there anything in the hearts of the prophets who prophesy falsehood, even these prophets of the deception of their own heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who intend to make My people forget My name by their dreams which they relate to one another, just as their fathers forgot My name because of Baal?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet who has a dream may relate his dream, but let him who has My word speak My word in truth. What does straw have in common with grain?” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not My word like fire?” declares the Lord, “and like a hammer which shatters a rock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” declares the Lord, “who steal My words from each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against the prophets,” declares the Lord, “who use their tongues and declare, ‘The Lord declares.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against those who have prophesied false dreams,” declares the Lord, “and related them and led My people astray by their falsehoods and reckless boasting; yet I did not send them or command them, nor do they furnish this people the slightest benefit,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when this people or the prophet or a priest asks you saying, ‘What is the oracle of the Lord?’ then you shall say to them, ‘What oracle?’ The Lord declares, ‘I will abandon you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then as for the prophet or the priest or the people who say, ‘The oracle of the Lord,’ I will bring punishment upon that man and his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus will each of you say to his neighbor and to his brother, ‘What has the Lord answered?’ or, ‘What has the Lord spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you will no longer remember the oracle of the Lord, because every man’s own word will become the oracle, and you have perverted the words of the living God, the Lord of hosts, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you will say to that prophet, ‘What has the Lord answered you?’ and, ‘What has the Lord spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you say, ‘The oracle of the Lord!’ surely thus says the Lord, ‘Because you said this word, “The oracle of the Lord!” I have also sent to you, saying, “You shall not say, ‘The oracle of the Lord!’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore behold, I will surely forget you and cast you away from My presence, along with the city which I gave you and your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put an everlasting reproach on you and an everlasting humiliation which will not be forgotten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the officials of Judah with the craftsmen and smiths from Jerusalem and had brought them to Babylon, the Lord showed me: behold, two baskets of figs set before the temple of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like first-ripe figs, and the other basket had very bad figs which could not be eaten due to rottenness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” And I said, “Figs, the good figs, very good; and the bad figs, very bad, which cannot be eaten due to rottenness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘Like these good figs, so I will regard as good the captives of Judah, whom I have sent out of this place into the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will set My eyes on them for good, and I will bring them again to this land; and I will build them up and not overthrow them, and I will plant them and not pluck them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them a heart to know Me, for I am the Lord; and they will be My people, and I will be their God, for they will return to Me with their whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But like the bad figs which cannot be eaten due to rottenness—indeed, thus says the Lord—so I will abandon Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials, and the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land and the ones who dwell in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them a terror and an evil for all the kingdoms of the earth, as a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse in all places where I will scatter them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send the sword, the famine and the pestilence upon them until they are destroyed from the land which I gave to them and their forefathers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (that was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, even to this day, these twenty-three years the word of the Lord has come to me, and I have spoken to you again and again, but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord has sent to you all His servants the prophets again and again, but you have not listened nor inclined your ear to hear,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘Turn now everyone from his evil way and from the evil of your deeds, and dwell on the land which the Lord has given to you and your forefathers forever and ever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and do not go after other gods to serve them and to worship them, and do not provoke Me to anger with the work of your hands, and I will do you no harm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not listened to Me,” declares the Lord, “in order that you might provoke Me to anger with the work of your hands to your own harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, ‘Because you have not obeyed My words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I will send and take all the families of the north,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will send to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, My servant, and will bring them against this land and against its inhabitants and against all these nations round about; and I will utterly destroy them and make them a horror and a hissing, and an everlasting desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will take from them the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole land will be a desolation and a horror, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then it will be when seventy years are completed I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation,’ declares the Lord, ‘for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans; and I will make it an everlasting desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring upon that land all My words which I have pronounced against it, all that is written in this book which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For many nations and great kings will make slaves of them, even them; and I will recompense them according to their deeds and according to the work of their hands.)’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus the Lord, the God of Israel, says to me, “Take this cup of the wine of wrath from My hand and cause all the nations to whom I send you to drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will drink and stagger and go mad because of the sword that I will send among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the cup from the Lord’s hand and made all the nations to whom the Lord sent me drink it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah and its kings and its princes, to make them a ruin, a horror, a hissing and a curse, as it is this day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his princes and all his people;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the foreign people, all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the land of the Philistines (even Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron and the remnant of Ashdod);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab and the sons of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon and the kings of the coastlands which are beyond the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Dedan, Tema, Buz and all who cut the corners of their hair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the foreign people who dwell in the desert;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam and all the kings of Media;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the kings of the north, near and far, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the earth which are upon the face of the ground, and the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Drink, be drunk, vomit, fall and rise no more because of the sword which I will send among you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be, if they refuse to take the cup from your hand to drink, then you will say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: “You shall surely drink!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I am beginning to work calamity in this city which is called by My name, and shall you be completely free from punishment? You will not be free from punishment; for I am summoning a sword against all the inhabitants of the earth,” declares the Lord of hosts.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore you shall prophesy against them all these words, and you shall say to them,
‘The Lord will roar from on high
And utter His voice from His holy habitation;
He will roar mightily against His fold.
He will shout like those who tread the grapes,
Against all the inhabitants of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘A clamor has come to the end of the earth,
Because the Lord has a controversy with the nations.
He is entering into judgment with all flesh;
As for the wicked, He has given them to the sword,’ declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts,
“Behold, evil is going forth
From nation to nation,
And a great storm is being stirred up
From the remotest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Those slain by the Lord on that day will be from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be lamented, gathered or buried; they will be like dung on the face of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Flight will perish from the shepherds,
And escape from the masters of the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear the sound of the cry of the shepherds,
And the wailing of the masters of the flock!
For the Lord is destroying their pasture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And the peaceful folds are made silent
Because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has left His hiding place like the lion;
For their land has become a horror
Because of the fierceness of the oppressing sword
And because of His fierce anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, ‘Stand in the court of the Lord’s house, and speak to all the cities of Judah who have come to worship in the Lord’s house all the words that I have commanded you to speak to them. Do not omit a word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps they will listen and everyone will turn from his evil way, that I may repent of the calamity which I am planning to do to them because of the evil of their deeds.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord, “If you will not listen to Me, to walk in My law which I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to listen to the words of My servants the prophets, whom I have been sending to you again and again, but you have not listened;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and this city I will make a curse to all the nations of the earth.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jeremiah finished speaking all that the Lord had commanded him to speak to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people seized him, saying, “You must die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you prophesied in the name of the Lord saying, ‘This house will be like Shiloh and this city will be desolate, without inhabitant’?” And all the people gathered about Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officials of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king’s house to the house of the Lord and sat in the entrance of the New Gate of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests and the prophets spoke to the officials and to all the people, saying, “A death sentence for this man! For he has prophesied against this city as you have heard in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the officials and to all the people, saying, “The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words that you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore amend your ways and your deeds and obey the voice of the Lord your God; and the Lord will change His mind about the misfortune which He has pronounced against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, behold, I am in your hands; do with me as is good and right in your sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only know for certain that if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves, and on this city and on its inhabitants; for truly the Lord has sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and to the prophets, “No death sentence for this man! For he has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the elders of the land rose up and spoke to all the assembly of the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah; and he spoke to all the people of Judah, saying, ‘Thus the Lord of hosts has said,
“Zion will be plowed as a field,
And Jerusalem will become ruins,
And the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Did he not fear the Lord and entreat the favor of the Lord, and the Lord changed His mind about the misfortune which He had pronounced against them? But we are committing a great evil against ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, there was also a man who prophesied in the name of the Lord, Uriah the son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim; and he prophesied against this city and against this land words similar to all those of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jehoiakim and all his mighty men and all the officials heard his words, then the king sought to put him to death; but Uriah heard it, and he was afraid and fled and went to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Jehoiakim sent men to Egypt: Elnathan the son of Achbor and certain men with him went into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought Uriah from Egypt and led him to King Jehoiakim, who slew him with a sword and cast his dead body into the burial place of the common people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, so that he was not given into the hands of the people to put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord to me—“Make for yourself bonds and yokes and put them on your neck,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and send word to the king of Edom, to the king of Moab, to the king of the sons of Ammon, to the king of Tyre and to the king of Sidon by the messengers who come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command them to go to their masters, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, thus you shall say to your masters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have made the earth, the men and the beasts which are on the face of the earth by My great power and by My outstretched arm, and I will give it to the one who is pleasing in My sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, My servant, and I have given him also the wild animals of the field to serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations shall serve him and his son and his grandson until the time of his own land comes; then many nations and great kings will make him their servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It will be, that the nation or the kingdom which will not serve him, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and which will not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, I will punish that nation with the sword, with famine and with pestilence,” declares the Lord, “until I have destroyed it by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your dreamers, your soothsayers or your sorcerers who speak to you, saying, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they prophesy a lie to you in order to remove you far from your land; and I will drive you out and you will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the nation which will bring its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will let remain on its land,” declares the Lord, “and they will till it and dwell in it.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke words like all these to Zedekiah king of Judah, saying, “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him and his people, and live!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, famine and pestilence, as the Lord has spoken to that nation which will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not listen to the words of the prophets who speak to you, saying, ‘You will not serve the king of Babylon,’ for they prophesy a lie to you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not sent them,” declares the Lord, “but they prophesy falsely in My name, in order that I may drive you out and that you may perish, you and the prophets who prophesy to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, “Thus says the Lord: Do not listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, ‘Behold, the vessels of the Lord’s house will now shortly be brought again from Babylon’; for they are prophesying a lie to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to them; serve the king of Babylon, and live! Why should this city become a ruin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they are prophets, and if the word of the Lord is with them, let them now entreat the Lord of hosts that the vessels which are left in the house of the Lord, in the house of the king of Judah and in Jerusalem may not go to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the pillars, concerning the sea, concerning the stands and concerning the rest of the vessels that are left in this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take when he carried into exile Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that are left in the house of the Lord and in the house of the king of Judah and in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They will be carried to Babylon and they will be there until the day I visit them,’ declares the Lord. ‘Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the same year, in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet, who was from Gibeon, spoke to me in the house of the Lord in the presence of the priests and all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two years I am going to bring back to this place all the vessels of the Lord’s house, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am also going to bring back to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and all the exiles of Judah who went to Babylon,’ declares the Lord, ‘for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah spoke to the prophet Hananiah in the presence of the priests and in the presence of all the people who were standing in the house of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! May the Lord do so; may the Lord confirm your words which you have prophesied to bring back the vessels of the Lord’s house and all the exiles, from Babylon to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet hear now this word which I am about to speak in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets who were before me and before you from ancient times prophesied against many lands and against great kingdoms, of war and of calamity and of pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet comes to pass, then that prophet will be known as one whom the Lord has truly sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from the neck of Jeremiah the prophet and broke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “Thus says the Lord, ‘Even so will I break within two full years the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all the nations.’” Then the prophet Jeremiah went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah after Hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and speak to Hananiah, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord, “You have broken the yokes of wood, but you have made instead of them yokes of iron.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “I have put a yoke of iron on the neck of all these nations, that they may serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they will serve him. And I have also given him the beasts of the field.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to Hananiah the prophet, “Listen now, Hananiah, the Lord has not sent you, and you have made this people trust in a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord, ‘Behold, I am about to remove you from the face of the earth. This year you are going to die, because you have counseled rebellion against the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hananiah the prophet died in the same year in the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the words of the letter which Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the rest of the elders of the exile, the priests, the prophets and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had taken into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was after King Jeconiah and the queen mother, the court officials, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen and the smiths had departed from Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The letter was sent by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan, and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, to all the exiles whom I have sent into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Build houses and live in them; and plant gardens and eat their produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take wives and become the fathers of sons and daughters, and take wives for your sons and give your daughters to husbands, that they may bear sons and daughters; and multiply there and do not decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek the welfare of the city where I have sent you into exile, and pray to the Lord on its behalf; for in its welfare you will have welfare.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Do not let your prophets who are in your midst and your diviners deceive you, and do not listen to the dreams which they dream.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they prophesy falsely to you in My name; I have not sent them,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord, ‘When seventy years have been completed for Babylon, I will visit you and fulfill My good word to you, to bring you back to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the plans that I have for you,’ declares the Lord, ‘plans for welfare and not for calamity to give you a future and a hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call upon Me and come and pray to Me, and I will listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be found by you,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will restore your fortunes and will gather you from all the nations and from all the places where I have driven you,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will bring you back to the place from where I sent you into exile.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because you have said, ‘The Lord has raised up prophets for us in Babylon’—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for thus says the Lord concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your brothers who did not go with you into exile—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord of hosts, ‘Behold, I am sending upon them the sword, famine and pestilence, and I will make them like split-open figs that cannot be eaten due to rottenness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pursue them with the sword, with famine and with pestilence; and I will make them a terror to all the kingdoms of the earth, to be a curse and a horror and a hissing, and a reproach among all the nations where I have driven them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have not listened to My words,’ declares the Lord, ‘which I sent to them again and again by My servants the prophets; but you did not listen,’ declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, therefore, hear the word of the Lord, all you exiles, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying to you falsely in My name, ‘Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will slay them before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of them a curse will be used by all the exiles from Judah who are in Babylon, saying, “May the Lord make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have acted foolishly in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives and have spoken words in My name falsely, which I did not command them; and I am He who knows and am a witness,” declares the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall speak, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Because you have sent letters in your own name to all the people who are in Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord has made you priest instead of Jehoiada the priest, to be the overseer in the house of the Lord over every madman who prophesies, to put him in the stocks and in the iron collar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: now then, why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth who prophesies to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, ‘The exile will be long; build houses and live in them and plant gardens and eat their produce.’”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zephaniah the priest read this letter to Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the word of the Lord to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send to all the exiles, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite, “Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, although I did not send him, and he has made you trust in a lie,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord, “Behold, I am about to punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants; he will not have anyone living among this people, and he will not see the good that I am about to do to My people,” declares the Lord, “because he has preached rebellion against the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, ‘Write all the words which I have spoken to you in a book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when I will restore the fortunes of My people Israel and Judah.’ The Lord says, ‘I will also bring them back to the land that I gave to their forefathers and they shall possess it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the words which the Lord spoke concerning Israel and concerning Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For thus says the Lord,
‘I have heard a sound of terror,
Of dread, and there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Ask now, and see
If a male can give birth.
Why do I see every man
With his hands on his loins, as a woman in childbirth?
And why have all faces turned pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Alas! for that day is great,
There is none like it;
And it is the time of Jacob’s distress,
But he will be saved from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘It shall come about on that day,’ declares the Lord of hosts, ‘that I will break his yoke from off their neck and will tear off their bonds; and strangers will no longer make them their slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shall serve the Lord their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Fear not, O Jacob My servant,’ declares the Lord,
‘And do not be dismayed, O Israel;
For behold, I will save you from afar
And your offspring from the land of their captivity.
And Jacob will return and will be quiet and at ease,
And no one will make him afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘For I am with you,’ declares the Lord, ‘to save you;
For I will destroy completely all the nations where I have scattered you,
Only I will not destroy you completely.
But I will chasten you justly
And will by no means leave you unpunished.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For thus says the Lord,
‘Your wound is incurable
And your injury is serious.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘All your lovers have forgotten you,
They do not seek you;
For I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy,
With the punishment of a cruel one,
Because your iniquity is great
And your sins are numerous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Why do you cry out over your injury?
Your pain is incurable.
Because your iniquity is great
And your sins are numerous,
I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘For I will restore you to health
And I will heal you of your wounds,’ declares the Lord,
‘Because they have called you an outcast, saying:
“It is Zion; no one cares for her.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord,
‘Behold, I will restore the fortunes of the tents of Jacob
And have compassion on his dwelling places;
And the city will be rebuilt on its ruin,
And the palace will stand on its rightful place.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
‘You shall be My people,
And I will be your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the tempest of the Lord!
Wrath has gone forth,
A sweeping tempest;
It will burst on the head of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fierce anger of the Lord will not turn back
Until He has performed and until He has accomplished
The intent of His heart;
In the latter days you will understand this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” declares the Lord, “I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be My people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
“The people who survived the sword
Found grace in the wilderness—
Israel, when it went to find its rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Again I will build you and you will be rebuilt,
O virgin of Israel!
Again you will take up your tambourines,
And go forth to the dances of the merrymakers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Again you will plant vineyards
On the hills of Samaria;
The planters will plant
And will enjoy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For there will be a day when watchmen
On the hills of Ephraim call out,
‘Arise, and let us go up to Zion,
To the Lord our God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord,
“Sing aloud with gladness for Jacob,
And shout among the chief of the nations;
Proclaim, give praise and say,
‘O Lord, save Your people,
The remnant of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am bringing them from the north country,
And I will gather them from the remote parts of the earth,
Among them the blind and the lame,
The woman with child and she who is in labor with child, together;
A great company, they will return here.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord, O nations,
And declare in the coastlands afar off,
And say, “He who scattered Israel will gather him
And keep him as a shepherd keeps his flock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has ransomed Jacob
And redeemed him from the hand of him who was stronger than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They will come and shout for joy on the height of Zion,
And they will be radiant over the bounty of the Lord—
Over the grain and the new wine and the oil,
And over the young of the flock and the herd;
And their life will be like a watered garden,
And they will never languish again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then the virgin will rejoice in the dance,
And the young men and the old, together,
For I will turn their mourning into joy
And will comfort them and give them joy for their sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will fill the soul of the priests with abundance,
And My people will be satisfied with My goodness,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
“A voice is heard in Ramah,
Lamentation and bitter weeping.
Rachel is weeping for her children;
She refuses to be comforted for her children,
Because they are no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
“Restrain your voice from weeping
And your eyes from tears;
For your work will be rewarded,” declares the Lord,
“And they will return from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“There is hope for your future,” declares the Lord,
“And your children will return to their own territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have surely heard Ephraim grieving,
‘You have chastised me, and I was chastised,
Like an untrained calf;
Bring me back that I may be restored,
For You are the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Set up for yourself roadmarks,
Place for yourself guideposts;
Direct your mind to the highway,
The way by which you went.
Return, O virgin of Israel,
Return to these your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long will you go here and there,
O faithless daughter?
For the Lord has created a new thing in the earth—
A woman will encompass a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Once again they will speak this word in the land of Judah and in its cities when I restore their fortunes,
‘The Lord bless you, O abode of righteousness,
O holy hill!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah and all its cities will dwell together in it, the farmer and they who go about with flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I satisfy the weary ones and refresh everyone who languishes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this I awoke and looked, and my sleep was pleasant to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and with the seed of beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I have watched over them to pluck up, to break down, to overthrow, to destroy and to bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In those days they will not say again,
‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
And the children’s teeth are set on edge.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But everyone will die for his own iniquity; each man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth will be set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not like the covenant which I made with their fathers in the day I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt, My covenant which they broke, although I was a husband to them,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But this is the covenant which I will make with the house of Israel after those days,” declares the Lord, “I will put My law within them and on their heart I will write it; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will not teach again, each man his neighbor and each man his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’ for they will all know Me, from the least of them to the greatest of them,” declares the Lord, “for I will forgive their iniquity, and their sin I will remember no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
Who gives the sun for light by day
And the fixed order of the moon and the stars for light by night,
Who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar;
The Lord of hosts is His name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If this fixed order departs
From before Me,” declares the Lord,
“Then the offspring of Israel also will cease
From being a nation before Me forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
“If the heavens above can be measured
And the foundations of the earth searched out below,
Then I will also cast off all the offspring of Israel
For all that they have done,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when the city will be rebuilt for the Lord from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The measuring line will go out farther straight ahead to the hill Gareb; then it will turn to Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields as far as the brook Kidron, to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, shall be holy to the Lord; it will not be plucked up or overthrown anymore forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at that time the army of the king of Babylon was besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard, which was in the house of the king of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Zedekiah king of Judah had shut him up, saying, “Why do you prophesy, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord, “Behold, I am about to give this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will take it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but he will surely be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will speak with him face to face and see him eye to eye;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he will take Zedekiah to Babylon, and he will be there until I visit him,” declares the Lord. “If you fight against the Chaldeans, you will not succeed”’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeremiah said, “The word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle is coming to you, saying, “Buy for yourself my field which is at Anathoth, for you have the right of redemption to buy it.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hanamel my uncle’s son came to me in the court of the guard according to the word of the Lord and said to me, ‘Buy my field, please, that is at Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for you have the right of possession and the redemption is yours; buy it for yourself.’ Then I knew that this was the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I bought the field which was at Anathoth from Hanamel my uncle’s son, and I weighed out the silver for him, seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I signed and sealed the deed, and called in witnesses, and weighed out the silver on the scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the deeds of purchase, both the sealed copy containing the terms and conditions and the open copy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I gave the deed of purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, in the sight of Hanamel my uncle’s son and in the sight of the witnesses who signed the deed of purchase, before all the Jews who were sitting in the court of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I commanded Baruch in their presence, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Take these deeds, this sealed deed of purchase and this open deed, and put them in an earthenware jar, that they may last a long time.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Houses and fields and vineyards will again be bought in this land.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, then I prayed to the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Ah Lord God! Behold, You have made the heavens and the earth by Your great power and by Your outstretched arm! Nothing is too difficult for You,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shows lovingkindness to thousands, but repays the iniquity of fathers into the bosom of their children after them, O great and mighty God. The Lord of hosts is His name;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: great in counsel and mighty in deed, whose eyes are open to all the ways of the sons of men, giving to everyone according to his ways and according to the fruit of his deeds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has set signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, and even to this day both in Israel and among mankind; and You have made a name for Yourself, as at this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brought Your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and with wonders, and with a strong hand and with an outstretched arm and with great terror;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and gave them this land, which You swore to their forefathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came in and took possession of it, but they did not obey Your voice or walk in Your law; they have done nothing of all that You commanded them to do; therefore You have made all this calamity come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the siege ramps have reached the city to take it; and the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans who fight against it, because of the sword, the famine and the pestilence; and what You have spoken has come to pass; and behold, You see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have said to me, O Lord God, “Buy for yourself the field with money and call in witnesses”—although the city is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh; is anything too difficult for Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord, “Behold, I am about to give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans who are fighting against this city will enter and set this city on fire and burn it, with the houses where people have offered incense to Baal on their roofs and poured out drink offerings to other gods to provoke Me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed the sons of Israel and the sons of Judah have been doing only evil in My sight from their youth; for the sons of Israel have been only provoking Me to anger by the work of their hands,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Indeed this city has been to Me a provocation of My anger and My wrath from the day that they built it, even to this day, so that it should be removed from before My face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of all the evil of the sons of Israel and the sons of Judah which they have done to provoke Me to anger—they, their kings, their leaders, their priests, their prophets, the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned their back to Me and not their face; though I taught them, teaching again and again, they would not listen and receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they put their detestable things in the house which is called by My name, to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built the high places of Baal that are in the valley of Ben-hinnom to cause their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire to Molech, which I had not commanded them nor had it entered My mind that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore thus says the Lord God of Israel concerning this city of which you say, ‘It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon by sword, by famine and by pestilence.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will gather them out of all the lands to which I have driven them in My anger, in My wrath and in great indignation; and I will bring them back to this place and make them dwell in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be My people, and I will be their God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear Me always, for their own good and for the good of their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make an everlasting covenant with them that I will not turn away from them, to do them good; and I will put the fear of Me in their hearts so that they will not turn away from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will rejoice over them to do them good and will faithfully plant them in this land with all My heart and with all My soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, ‘Just as I brought all this great disaster on this people, so I am going to bring on them all the good that I am promising them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fields will be bought in this land of which you say, “It is a desolation, without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men will buy fields for money, sign and seal deeds, and call in witnesses in the land of Benjamin, in the environs of Jerusalem, in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland and in the cities of the Negev; for I will restore their fortunes,’ declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah the second time, while he was still confined in the court of the guard, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord who made the earth, the Lord who formed it to establish it, the Lord is His name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Call to Me and I will answer you, and I will tell you great and mighty things, which you do not know.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord God of Israel concerning the houses of this city, and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah which are broken down to make a defense against the siege ramps and against the sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘While they are coming to fight with the Chaldeans and to fill them with the corpses of men whom I have slain in My anger and in My wrath, and I have hidden My face from this city because of all their wickedness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will bring to it health and healing, and I will heal them; and I will reveal to them an abundance of peace and truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will restore the fortunes of Judah and the fortunes of Israel and will rebuild them as they were at first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity by which they have sinned against Me, and I will pardon all their iniquities by which they have sinned against Me and by which they have transgressed against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be to Me a name of joy, praise and glory before all the nations of the earth which will hear of all the good that I do for them, and they will fear and tremble because of all the good and all the peace that I make for it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, ‘Yet again there will be heard in this place, of which you say, “It is a waste, without man and without beast,” that is, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem that are desolate, without man and without inhabitant and without beast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the voice of joy and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voice of those who say,
“Give thanks to the Lord of hosts,
For the Lord is good,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting”;
and of those who bring a thank offering into the house of the Lord. For I will restore the fortunes of the land as they were at first,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, ‘There will again be in this place which is waste, without man or beast, and in all its cities, a habitation of shepherds who rest their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the lowland, in the cities of the Negev, in the land of Benjamin, in the environs of Jerusalem and in the cities of Judah, the flocks will again pass under the hands of the one who numbers them,’ says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, days are coming,’ declares the Lord, ‘when I will fulfill the good word which I have spoken concerning the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days and at that time I will cause a righteous Branch of David to spring forth; and He shall execute justice and righteousness on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Judah will be saved and Jerusalem will dwell in safety; and this is the name by which she will be called: the Lord is our righteousness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, ‘David shall never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Levitical priests shall never lack a man before Me to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings and to prepare sacrifices continually.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, ‘If you can break My covenant for the day and My covenant for the night, so that day and night will not be at their appointed time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then My covenant may also be broken with David My servant so that he will not have a son to reign on his throne, and with the Levitical priests, My ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the host of heaven cannot be counted and the sand of the sea cannot be measured, so I will multiply the descendants of David My servant and the Levites who minister to Me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you not observed what this people have spoken, saying, ‘The two families which the Lord chose, He has rejected them’? Thus they despise My people, no longer are they as a nation in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, ‘If My covenant for day and night stand not, and the fixed patterns of heaven and earth I have not established,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I would reject the descendants of Jacob and David My servant, not taking from his descendants rulers over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. But I will restore their fortunes and will have mercy on them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army, with all the kingdoms of the earth that were under his dominion and all the peoples, were fighting against Jerusalem and against all its cities, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and say to him: “Thus says the Lord, ‘Behold, I am giving this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will not escape from his hand, for you will surely be captured and delivered into his hand; and you will see the king of Babylon eye to eye, and he will speak with you face to face, and you will go to Babylon.’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet hear the word of the Lord, O Zedekiah king of Judah! Thus says the Lord concerning you, ‘You will not die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will die in peace; and as spices were burned for your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they will burn spices for you; and they will lament for you, “Alas, lord!”’ For I have spoken the word,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the remaining cities of Judah, that is, Lachish and Azekah, for they alone remained as fortified cities among the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were in Jerusalem to proclaim release to them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that each man should set free his male servant and each man his female servant, a Hebrew man or a Hebrew woman; so that no one should keep them, a Jew his brother, in bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the officials and all the people obeyed who had entered into the covenant that each man should set free his male servant and each man his female servant, so that no one should keep them any longer in bondage; they obeyed, and set them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward they turned around and took back the male servants and the female servants whom they had set free, and brought them into subjection for male servants and for female servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘I made a covenant with your forefathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the end of seven years each of you shall set free his Hebrew brother who has been sold to you and has served you six years, you shall send him out free from you; but your forefathers did not obey Me or incline their ear to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
