verses.text: Although recently you had turned and done what is right in My sight, each man proclaiming release to his neighbor, and you had made a covenant before Me in the house which is called by My name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you turned and profaned My name, and each man took back his male servant and each man his female servant whom you had set free according to their desire, and you brought them into subjection to be your male servants and female servants.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord, ‘You have not obeyed Me in proclaiming release each man to his brother and each man to his neighbor. Behold, I am proclaiming a release to you,’ declares the Lord, ‘to the sword, to the pestilence and to the famine; and I will make you a terror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give the men who have transgressed My covenant, who have not fulfilled the words of the covenant which they made before Me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between its parts—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the officials of Judah and the officials of Jerusalem, the court officers and the priests and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their life. And their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials I will give into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their life, and into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon which has gone away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am going to command,’ declares the Lord, ‘and I will bring them back to this city; and they will fight against it and take it and burn it with fire; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without inhabitant.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to the house of the Rechabites and speak to them, and bring them into the house of the Lord, into one of the chambers, and give them wine to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, son of Habazziniah, and his brothers and all his sons and the whole house of the Rechabites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I brought them into the house of the Lord, into the chamber of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, the man of God, which was near the chamber of the officials, which was above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, the doorkeeper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I set before the men of the house of the Rechabites pitchers full of wine and cups; and I said to them, “Drink wine!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said, “We will not drink wine, for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, saying, ‘You shall not drink wine, you or your sons, forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not build a house, and you shall not sow seed and you shall not plant a vineyard or own one; but in tents you shall dwell all your days, that you may live many days in the land where you sojourn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he commanded us, not to drink wine all our days, we, our wives, our sons or our daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor to build ourselves houses to dwell in; and we do not have vineyard or field or seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have only dwelt in tents, and have obeyed and have done according to all that Jonadab our father commanded us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against the land, we said, ‘Come and let us go to Jerusalem before the army of the Chaldeans and before the army of the Arameans.’ So we have dwelt in Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Go and say to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, “Will you not receive instruction by listening to My words?” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The words of Jonadab the son of Rechab, which he commanded his sons not to drink wine, are observed. So they do not drink wine to this day, for they have obeyed their father’s command. But I have spoken to you again and again; yet you have not listened to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I have sent to you all My servants the prophets, sending them again and again, saying: ‘Turn now every man from his evil way and amend your deeds, and do not go after other gods to worship them. Then you will dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your forefathers; but you have not inclined your ear or listened to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have observed the command of their father which he commanded them, but this people has not listened to Me.’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Behold, I am bringing on Judah and on all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the disaster that I have pronounced against them; because I spoke to them but they did not listen, and I have called them but they did not answer.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to the house of the Rechabites, “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Because you have obeyed the command of Jonadab your father, kept all his commands and done according to all that he commanded you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Jonadab the son of Rechab shall not lack a man to stand before Me always.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a scroll and write on it all the words which I have spoken to you concerning Israel and concerning Judah, and concerning all the nations, from the day I first spoke to you, from the days of Josiah, even to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps the house of Judah will hear all the calamity which I plan to bring on them, in order that every man will turn from his evil way; then I will forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah, and Baruch wrote on a scroll at the dictation of Jeremiah all the words of the Lord which He had spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am restricted; I cannot go into the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you go and read from the scroll which you have written at my dictation the words of the Lord to the people in the Lord’s house on a fast day. And also you shall read them to all the people of Judah who come from their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Perhaps their supplication will come before the Lord, and everyone will turn from his evil way, for great is the anger and the wrath that the Lord has pronounced against this people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading from the book the words of the Lord in the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, all the people in Jerusalem and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem proclaimed a fast before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baruch read from the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the Lord in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the New Gate of the Lord’s house, to all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Micaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard all the words of the Lord from the book,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he went down to the king’s house, into the scribe’s chamber. And behold, all the officials were sitting there—Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard when Baruch read from the book to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the officials sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll from which you have read to the people and come.” So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand and went to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Sit down, please, and read it to us.” So Baruch read it to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had heard all the words, they turned in fear one to another and said to Baruch, “We will surely report all these words to the king.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us, please, how did you write all these words? Was it at his dictation?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Baruch said to them, “He dictated all these words to me, and I wrote them with ink on the book.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials said to Baruch, “Go, hide yourself, you and Jeremiah, and do not let anyone know where you are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went to the king in the court, but they had deposited the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and they reported all the words to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he took it out of the chamber of Elishama the scribe. And Jehudi read it to the king as well as to all the officials who stood beside the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month, with a fire burning in the brazier before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jehudi had read three or four columns, the king cut it with a scribe’s knife and threw it into the fire that was in the brazier, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was in the brazier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the king and all his servants who heard all these words were not afraid, nor did they rend their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah pleaded with the king not to burn the scroll, he would not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel to seize Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet, but the Lord hid them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah after the king had burned the scroll and the words which Baruch had written at the dictation of Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take again another scroll and write on it all the former words that were on the first scroll which Jehoiakim the king of Judah burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, ‘Thus says the Lord, “You have burned this scroll, saying, ‘Why have you written on it that the king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and will make man and beast to cease from it?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah, “He shall have no one to sit on the throne of David, and his dead body shall be cast out to the heat of the day and the frost of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also punish him and his descendants and his servants for their iniquity, and I will bring on them and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the men of Judah all the calamity that I have declared to them—but they did not listen.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch the son of Neriah, the scribe, and he wrote on it at the dictation of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and many similar words were added to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Zedekiah the son of Josiah whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had made king in the land of Judah, reigned as king in place of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But neither he nor his servants nor the people of the land listened to the words of the Lord which He spoke through Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet King Zedekiah sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “Please pray to the Lord our God on our behalf.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jeremiah was still coming in and going out among the people, for they had not yet put him in the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, Pharaoh’s army had set out from Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who had been besieging Jerusalem heard the report about them, they lifted the siege from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah the prophet, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God of Israel, ‘Thus you are to say to the king of Judah, who sent you to Me to inquire of Me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army which has come out for your assistance is going to return to its own land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans will also return and fight against this city, and they will capture it and burn it with fire.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, ‘Do not deceive yourselves, saying, “The Chaldeans will surely go away from us,” for they will not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even if you had defeated the entire army of Chaldeans who were fighting against you, and there were only wounded men left among them, each man in his tent, they would rise up and burn this city with fire.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened when the army of the Chaldeans had lifted the siege from Jerusalem because of Pharaoh’s army,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that Jeremiah went out from Jerusalem to go to the land of Benjamin in order to take possession of some property there among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was at the Gate of Benjamin, a captain of the guard whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah the son of Hananiah was there; and he arrested Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “You are going over to the Chaldeans!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jeremiah said, “A lie! I am not going over to the Chaldeans”; yet he would not listen to him. So Irijah arrested Jeremiah and brought him to the officials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials were angry at Jeremiah and beat him, and they put him in jail in the house of Jonathan the scribe, which they had made into the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jeremiah had come into the dungeon, that is, the vaulted cell; and Jeremiah stayed there many days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now King Zedekiah sent and took him out; and in his palace the king secretly asked him and said, “Is there a word from the Lord?” And Jeremiah said, “There is!” Then he said, “You will be given into the hand of the king of Babylon!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, “In what way have I sinned against you, or against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where then are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you or against this land’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, please listen, O my lord the king; please let my petition come before you and do not make me return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, that I may not die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Zedekiah gave commandment, and they committed Jeremiah to the court of the guardhouse and gave him a loaf of bread daily from the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was gone. So Jeremiah remained in the court of the guardhouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Shephatiah the son of Mattan, and Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, and Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchijah heard the words that Jeremiah was speaking to all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, ‘He who stays in this city will die by the sword and by famine and by pestilence, but he who goes out to the Chaldeans will live and have his own life as booty and stay alive.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, ‘This city will certainly be given into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon and he will capture it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials said to the king, “Now let this man be put to death, inasmuch as he is discouraging the men of war who are left in this city and all the people, by speaking such words to them; for this man is not seeking the well-being of this people but rather their harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King Zedekiah said, “Behold, he is in your hands; for the king can do nothing against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took Jeremiah and cast him into the cistern of Malchijah the king’s son, which was in the court of the guardhouse; and they let Jeremiah down with ropes. Now in the cistern there was no water but only mud, and Jeremiah sank into the mud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, while he was in the king’s palace, heard that they had put Jeremiah into the cistern. Now the king was sitting in the Gate of Benjamin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ebed-melech went out from the king’s palace and spoke to the king, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My lord the king, these men have acted wickedly in all that they have done to Jeremiah the prophet whom they have cast into the cistern; and he will die right where he is because of the famine, for there is no more bread in the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king commanded Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, “Take thirty men from here under your authority and bring up Jeremiah the prophet from the cistern before he dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ebed-melech took the men under his authority and went into the king’s palace to a place beneath the storeroom and took from there worn-out clothes and worn-out rags and let them down by ropes into the cistern to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ebed-melech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, “Now put these worn-out clothes and rags under your armpits under the ropes”; and Jeremiah did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they pulled Jeremiah up with the ropes and lifted him out of the cistern, and Jeremiah stayed in the court of the guardhouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Zedekiah sent and had Jeremiah the prophet brought to him at the third entrance that is in the house of the Lord; and the king said to Jeremiah, “I am going to ask you something; do not hide anything from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “If I tell you, will you not certainly put me to death? Besides, if I give you advice, you will not listen to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King Zedekiah swore to Jeremiah in secret saying, “As the Lord lives, who made this life for us, surely I will not put you to death nor will I give you over to the hand of these men who are seeking your life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, “Thus says the Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘If you will indeed go out to the officers of the king of Babylon, then you will live, this city will not be burned with fire, and you and your household will survive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not go out to the officers of the king of Babylon, then this city will be given over to the hand of the Chaldeans; and they will burn it with fire, and you yourself will not escape from their hand.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “I dread the Jews who have gone over to the Chaldeans, for they may give me over into their hand and they will abuse me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jeremiah said, “They will not give you over. Please obey the Lord in what I am saying to you, that it may go well with you and you may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you keep refusing to go out, this is the word which the Lord has shown me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Then behold, all of the women who have been left in the palace of the king of Judah are going to be brought out to the officers of the king of Babylon; and those women will say,
“Your close friends
Have misled and overpowered you;
While your feet were sunk in the mire,
They turned back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will also bring out all your wives and your sons to the Chaldeans, and you yourself will not escape from their hand, but will be seized by the hand of the king of Babylon, and this city will be burned with fire.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, “Let no man know about these words and you will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the officials hear that I have talked with you and come to you and say to you, ‘Tell us now what you said to the king and what the king said to you; do not hide it from us and we will not put you to death,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you are to say to them, ‘I was presenting my petition before the king, not to make me return to the house of Jonathan to die there.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the officials came to Jeremiah and questioned him. So he reported to them in accordance with all these words which the king had commanded; and they ceased speaking with him, since the conversation had not been overheard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jeremiah stayed in the court of the guardhouse until the day that Jerusalem was captured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jerusalem was captured in the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army came to Jerusalem and laid siege to it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the city wall was breached.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the officials of the king of Babylon came in and sat down at the Middle Gate: Nergal-sar-ezer, Samgar-nebu, Sar-sekim the Rab-saris, Nergal-sar-ezer the Rab-mag, and all the rest of the officials of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zedekiah the king of Judah and all the men of war saw them, they fled and went out of the city at night by way of the king’s garden through the gate between the two walls; and he went out toward the Arabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued them and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and they seized him and brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, and he passed sentence on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes at Riblah; the king of Babylon also slew all the nobles of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then blinded Zedekiah’s eyes and bound him in fetters of bronze to bring him to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans also burned with fire the king’s palace and the houses of the people, and they broke down the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the rest of the people who were left in the city, the deserters who had gone over to him and the rest of the people who remained, Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard carried them into exile in Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the poorest people who had nothing, Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard left behind in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon gave orders about Jeremiah through Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take him and look after him, and do nothing harmful to him, but rather deal with him just as he tells you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard sent word, along with Nebushazban the Rab-saris, and Nergal-sar-ezer the Rab-mag, and all the leading officers of the king of Babylon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they even sent and took Jeremiah out of the court of the guardhouse and entrusted him to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to take him home. So he stayed among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord had come to Jeremiah while he was confined in the court of the guardhouse, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Behold, I am about to bring My words on this city for disaster and not for prosperity; and they will take place before you on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will deliver you on that day,” declares the Lord, “and you will not be given into the hand of the men whom you dread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will certainly rescue you, and you will not fall by the sword; but you will have your own life as booty, because you have trusted in Me,” declares the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord after Nebuzaradan captain of the bodyguard had released him from Ramah, when he had taken him bound in chains among all the exiles of Jerusalem and Judah who were being exiled to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the captain of the bodyguard had taken Jeremiah and said to him, “The Lord your God promised this calamity against this place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Lord has brought it on and done just as He promised. Because you people sinned against the Lord and did not listen to His voice, therefore this thing has happened to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now, behold, I am freeing you today from the chains which are on your hands. If you would prefer to come with me to Babylon, come along, and I will look after you; but if you would prefer not to come with me to Babylon, never mind. Look, the whole land is before you; go wherever it seems good and right for you to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jeremiah was still not going back, he said, “Go on back then to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has appointed over the cities of Judah, and stay with him among the people; or else go anywhere it seems right for you to go.” So the captain of the bodyguard gave him a ration and a gift and let him go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah went to Mizpah to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam and stayed with him among the people who were left in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all the commanders of the forces that were in the field, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam over the land and that he had put him in charge of the men, women and children, those of the poorest of the land who had not been exiled to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah, along with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of the Maacathite, both they and their men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, swore to them and to their men, saying, “Do not be afraid of serving the Chaldeans; stay in the land and serve the king of Babylon, that it may go well with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for me, behold, I am going to stay at Mizpah to stand for you before the Chaldeans who come to us; but as for you, gather in wine and summer fruit and oil and put them in your storage vessels, and live in your cities that you have taken over.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, also all the Jews who were in Moab and among the sons of Ammon and in Edom and who were in all the other countries, heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant for Judah, and that he had appointed over them Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the Jews returned from all the places to which they had been driven away and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah, and gathered in wine and summer fruit in great abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were in the field came to Gedaliah at Mizpah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Are you well aware that Baalis the king of the sons of Ammon has sent Ishmael the son of Nethaniah to take your life?” But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam did not believe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah spoke secretly to Gedaliah in Mizpah, saying, “Let me go and kill Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and not a man will know! Why should he take your life, so that all the Jews who are gathered to you would be scattered and the remnant of Judah would perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Gedaliah the son of Ahikam said to Johanan the son of Kareah, “Do not do this thing, for you are telling a lie about Ishmael.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh month Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal family and one of the chief officers of the king, along with ten men, came to Mizpah to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam. While they were eating bread together there in Mizpah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and the ten men who were with him arose and struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, with the sword and put to death the one whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmael also struck down all the Jews who were with him, that is with Gedaliah at Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there, the men of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened on the next day after the killing of Gedaliah, when no one knew about it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that eighty men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria with their beards shaved off and their clothes torn and their bodies gashed, having grain offerings and incense in their hands to bring to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishmael the son of Nethaniah went out from Mizpah to meet them, weeping as he went; and as he met them, he said to them, “Come to Gedaliah the son of Ahikam!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet it turned out that as soon as they came inside the city, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and the men that were with him slaughtered them and cast them into the cistern.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ten men who were found among them said to Ishmael, “Do not put us to death; for we have stores of wheat, barley, oil and honey hidden in the field.” So he refrained and did not put them to death along with their companions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as for the cistern where Ishmael had cast all the corpses of the men whom he had struck down because of Gedaliah, it was the one that King Asa had made on account of Baasha, king of Israel; Ishmael the son of Nethaniah filled it with the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Ishmael took captive all the remnant of the people who were in Mizpah, the king’s daughters and all the people who were left in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard had put under the charge of Gedaliah the son of Ahikam; thus Ishmael the son of Nethaniah took them captive and proceeded to cross over to the sons of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were with him heard of all the evil that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took all the men and went to fight with Ishmael the son of Nethaniah and they found him by the great pool that is in Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as soon as all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan the son of Kareah and the commanders of the forces that were with him, they were glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the people whom Ishmael had taken captive from Mizpah turned around and came back, and went to Johanan the son of Kareah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ishmael the son of Nethaniah escaped from Johanan with eight men and went to the sons of Ammon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were with him took from Mizpah all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, after he had struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, that is, the men who were soldiers, the women, the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and stayed in Geruth Chimham, which is beside Bethlehem, in order to proceed into Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the Chaldeans; for they were afraid of them, since Ishmael the son of Nethaniah had struck down Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the commanders of the forces, Johanan the son of Kareah, Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people both small and great approached
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, “Please let our petition come before you, and pray for us to the Lord your God, that is for all this remnant; because we are left but a few out of many, as your own eyes now see us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Lord your God may tell us the way in which we should walk and the thing that we should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet said to them, “I have heard you. Behold, I am going to pray to the Lord your God in accordance with your words; and I will tell you the whole message which the Lord will answer you. I will not keep back a word from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Jeremiah, “May the Lord be a true and faithful witness against us if we do not act in accordance with the whole message with which the Lord your God will send you to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it is pleasant or unpleasant, we will listen to the voice of the Lord our God to whom we are sending you, so that it may go well with us when we listen to the voice of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the end of ten days the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called for Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces that were with him, and for all the people both small and great,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “Thus says the Lord the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your petition before Him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If you will indeed stay in this land, then I will build you up and not tear you down, and I will plant you and not uproot you; for I will relent concerning the calamity that I have inflicted on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you are now fearing; do not be afraid of him,’ declares the Lord, ‘for I am with you to save you and deliver you from his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also show you compassion, so that he will have compassion on you and restore you to your own soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are going to say, “We will not stay in this land,” so as not to listen to the voice of the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “No, but we will go to the land of Egypt, where we will not see war or hear the sound of a trumpet or hunger for bread, and we will stay there”;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then in that case listen to the word of the Lord, O remnant of Judah. Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “If you really set your mind to enter Egypt and go in to reside there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the sword, which you are afraid of, will overtake you there in the land of Egypt; and the famine, about which you are anxious, will follow closely after you there in Egypt, and you will die there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the men who set their mind to go to Egypt to reside there will die by the sword, by famine and by pestilence; and they will have no survivors or refugees from the calamity that I am going to bring on them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “As My anger and wrath have been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so My wrath will be poured out on you when you enter Egypt. And you will become a curse, an object of horror, an imprecation and a reproach; and you will see this place no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has spoken to you, O remnant of Judah, “Do not go into Egypt!” You should clearly understand that today I have testified against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have only deceived yourselves; for it is you who sent me to the Lord your God, saying, “Pray for us to the Lord our God; and whatever the Lord our God says, tell us so, and we will do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I have told you today, but you have not obeyed the Lord your God, even in whatever He has sent me to tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you should now clearly understand that you will die by the sword, by famine and by pestilence, in the place where you wish to go to reside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as Jeremiah, whom the Lord their God had sent, had finished telling all the people all the words of the Lord their God—that is, all these words—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah the son of Hoshaiah, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the arrogant men said to Jeremiah, “You are telling a lie! The Lord our God has not sent you to say, ‘You are not to enter Egypt to reside there’;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Baruch the son of Neriah is inciting you against us to give us over into the hand of the Chaldeans, so they will put us to death or exile us to Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces, and all the people, did not obey the voice of the Lord to stay in the land of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Johanan the son of Kareah and all the commanders of the forces took the entire remnant of Judah who had returned from all the nations to which they had been driven away, in order to reside in the land of Judah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the men, the women, the children, the king’s daughters and every person that Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard had left with Gedaliah the son of Ahikam and grandson of Shaphan, together with Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch the son of Neriah—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they entered the land of Egypt (for they did not obey the voice of the Lord) and went in as far as Tahpanhes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take some large stones in your hands and hide them in the mortar in the brick terrace which is at the entrance of Pharaoh’s palace in Tahpanhes, in the sight of some of the Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, “Behold, I am going to send and get Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, My servant, and I am going to set his throne right over these stones that I have hidden; and he will spread his canopy over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will also come and strike the land of Egypt; those who are meant for death will be given over to death, and those for captivity to captivity, and those for the sword to the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I shall set fire to the temples of the gods of Egypt, and he will burn them and take them captive. So he will wrap himself with the land of Egypt as a shepherd wraps himself with his garment, and he will depart from there safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will also shatter the obelisks of Heliopolis, which is in the land of Egypt; and the temples of the gods of Egypt he will burn with fire.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah for all the Jews living in the land of Egypt, those who were living in Migdol, Tahpanhes, Memphis, and the land of Pathros, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘You yourselves have seen all the calamity that I have brought on Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah; and behold, this day they are in ruins and no one lives in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of their wickedness which they committed so as to provoke Me to anger by continuing to burn sacrifices and to serve other gods whom they had not known, neither they, you, nor your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet I sent you all My servants the prophets, again and again, saying, “Oh, do not do this abominable thing which I hate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not listen or incline their ears to turn from their wickedness, so as not to burn sacrifices to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore My wrath and My anger were poured out and burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, so they have become a ruin and a desolation as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then thus says the Lord God of hosts, the God of Israel, “Why are you doing great harm to yourselves, so as to cut off from you man and woman, child and infant, from among Judah, leaving yourselves without remnant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: provoking Me to anger with the works of your hands, burning sacrifices to other gods in the land of Egypt, where you are entering to reside, so that you might be cut off and become a curse and a reproach among all the nations of the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you forgotten the wickedness of your fathers, the wickedness of the kings of Judah, and the wickedness of their wives, your own wickedness, and the wickedness of your wives, which they committed in the land of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they have not become contrite even to this day, nor have they feared nor walked in My law or My statutes, which I have set before you and before your fathers.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, ‘Behold, I am going to set My face against you for woe, even to cut off all Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will take away the remnant of Judah who have set their mind on entering the land of Egypt to reside there, and they will all meet their end in the land of Egypt; they will fall by the sword and meet their end by famine. Both small and great will die by the sword and famine; and they will become a curse, an object of horror, an imprecation and a reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will punish those who live in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, with the sword, with famine and with pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there will be no refugees or survivors for the remnant of Judah who have entered the land of Egypt to reside there and then to return to the land of Judah, to which they are longing to return and live; for none will return except a few refugees.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the men who were aware that their wives were burning sacrifices to other gods, along with all the women who were standing by, as a large assembly, including all the people who were living in Pathros in the land of Egypt, responded to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the message that you have spoken to us in the name of the Lord, we are not going to listen to you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But rather we will certainly carry out every word that has proceeded from our mouths, by burning sacrifices to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, just as we ourselves, our forefathers, our kings and our princes did in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then we had plenty of food and were well off and saw no misfortune.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since we stopped burning sacrifices to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have met our end by the sword and by famine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And,” said the women, “when we were burning sacrifices to the queen of heaven and were pouring out drink offerings to her, was it without our husbands that we made for her sacrificial cakes in her image and poured out drink offerings to her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, to the men and women—even to all the people who were giving him such an answer—saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for the smoking sacrifices that you burned in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, you and your forefathers, your kings and your princes, and the people of the land, did not the Lord remember them and did not all this come into His mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord was no longer able to endure it, because of the evil of your deeds, because of the abominations which you have committed; thus your land has become a ruin, an object of horror and a curse, without an inhabitant, as it is this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have burned sacrifices and have sinned against the Lord and not obeyed the voice of the Lord or walked in His law, His statutes or His testimonies, therefore this calamity has befallen you, as it has this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the people, including all the women, “Hear the word of the Lord, all Judah who are in the land of Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, as follows: ‘As for you and your wives, you have spoken with your mouths and fulfilled it with your hands, saying, “We will certainly perform our vows that we have vowed, to burn sacrifices to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her.” Go ahead and confirm your vows, and certainly perform your vows!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless hear the word of the Lord, all Judah who are living in the land of Egypt, ‘Behold, I have sworn by My great name,’ says the Lord, ‘never shall My name be invoked again by the mouth of any man of Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, “As the Lord God lives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am watching over them for harm and not for good, and all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt will meet their end by the sword and by famine until they are completely gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who escape the sword will return out of the land of Egypt to the land of Judah few in number. Then all the remnant of Judah who have gone to the land of Egypt to reside there will know whose word will stand, Mine or theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be the sign to you,’ declares the Lord, ‘that I am going to punish you in this place, so that you may know that My words will surely stand against you for harm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, ‘Behold, I am going to give over Pharaoh Hophra king of Egypt to the hand of his enemies, to the hand of those who seek his life, just as I gave over Zedekiah king of Judah to the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who was his enemy and was seeking his life.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written down these words in a book at Jeremiah’s dictation, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord the God of Israel to you, O Baruch:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You said, “Ah, woe is me! For the Lord has added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning and have found no rest.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you are to say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord, “Behold, what I have built I am about to tear down, and what I have planted I am about to uproot, that is, the whole land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, are you seeking great things for yourself? Do not seek them; for behold, I am going to bring disaster on all flesh,’ declares the Lord, ‘but I will give your life to you as booty in all the places where you may go.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which came as the word of the Lord to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Egypt, concerning the army of Pharaoh Neco king of Egypt, which was by the Euphrates River at Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Line up the shield and buckler,
And draw near for the battle!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Harness the horses,
And mount the steeds,
And take your stand with helmets on!
Polish the spears,
Put on the scale-armor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why have I seen it?
They are terrified,
They are drawing back,
And their mighty men are defeated
And have taken refuge in flight,
Without facing back;
Terror is on every side!”
Declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let not the swift man flee,
Nor the mighty man escape;
In the north beside the river Euphrates
They have stumbled and fallen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this that rises like the Nile,
Like the rivers whose waters surge about?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Go up, you horses, and drive madly, you chariots,
That the mighty men may march forward:
Ethiopia and Put, that handle the shield,
And the Lydians, that handle and bend the bow.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Go up to Gilead and obtain balm,
O virgin daughter of Egypt!
In vain have you multiplied remedies;
There is no healing for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations have heard of your shame,
And the earth is full of your cry of distress;
For one warrior has stumbled over another,
And both of them have fallen down together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message which the Lord spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about the coming of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to smite the land of Egypt:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare in Egypt and proclaim in Migdol,
Proclaim also in Memphis and Tahpanhes;
Say, ‘Take your stand and get yourself ready,
For the sword has devoured those around you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why have your mighty ones become prostrate?
They do not stand because the Lord has thrust them down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They have repeatedly stumbled;
Indeed, they have fallen one against another.
Then they said, ‘Get up! And let us go back
To our own people and our native land
Away from the sword of the oppressor.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They cried there, ‘Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a big noise;
He has let the appointed time pass by!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As I live,” declares the King
Whose name is the Lord of hosts,
“Surely one shall come who looms up like Tabor among the mountains,
Or like Carmel by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Make your baggage ready for exile,
O daughter dwelling in Egypt,
For Memphis will become a desolation;
It will even be burned down and bereft of inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Egypt is a pretty heifer,
But a horsefly is coming from the north—it is coming!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Also her mercenaries in her midst
Are like fattened calves,
For even they too have turned back and have fled away together;
They did not stand their ground.
For the day of their calamity has come upon them,
The time of their punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“They have cut down her forest,” declares the Lord;
“Surely it will no more be found,
Even though they are now more numerous than locusts
And are without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The daughter of Egypt has been put to shame,
Given over to the power of the people of the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, says, “Behold, I am going to punish Amon of Thebes, and Pharaoh, and Egypt along with her gods and her kings, even Pharaoh and those who trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I shall give them over to the power of those who are seeking their lives, even into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and into the hand of his officers. Afterwards, however, it will be inhabited as in the days of old,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But as for you, O Jacob My servant, do not fear,
Nor be dismayed, O Israel!
For, see, I am going to save you from afar,
And your descendants from the land of their captivity;
And Jacob will return and be undisturbed
And secure, with no one making him tremble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O Jacob My servant, do not fear,” declares the Lord,
“For I am with you.
For I will make a full end of all the nations
Where I have driven you,
Yet I will not make a full end of you;
But I will correct you properly
And by no means leave you unpunished.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which came as the word of the Lord to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh conquered Gaza.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Behold, waters are going to rise from the north
And become an overflowing torrent,
And overflow the land and all its fullness,
The city and those who live in it;
And the men will cry out,
And every inhabitant of the land will wail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because of the noise of the galloping hoofs of his stallions,
The tumult of his chariots, and the rumbling of his wheels,
The fathers have not turned back for their children,
Because of the limpness of their hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On account of the day that is coming
To destroy all the Philistines,
To cut off from Tyre and Sidon
Every ally that is left;
For the Lord is going to destroy the Philistines,
The remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Baldness has come upon Gaza;
Ashkelon has been ruined.
O remnant of their valley,
How long will you gash yourself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ah, sword of the Lord,
How long will you not be quiet?
Withdraw into your sheath;
Be at rest and stay still.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can it be quiet,
When the Lord has given it an order?
Against Ashkelon and against the seacoast—
There He has assigned it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The sound of an outcry from Horonaim,
‘Devastation and great destruction!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab is broken,
Her little ones have sounded out a cry of distress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For by the ascent of Luhith
They will ascend with continual weeping;
For at the descent of Horonaim
They have heard the anguished cry of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee, save your lives,
That you may be like a juniper in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For because of your trust in your own achievements and treasures,
Even you yourself will be captured;
And Chemosh will go off into exile
Together with his priests and his princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A destroyer will come to every city,
So that no city will escape;
The valley also will be ruined
And the plateau will be destroyed,
As the Lord has said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give wings to Moab,
For she will flee away;
And her cities will become a desolation,
Without inhabitants in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Cursed be the one who does the Lord’s work negligently,
And cursed be the one who restrains his sword from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab has been at ease since his youth;
He has also been undisturbed, like wine on its dregs,
And he has not been emptied from vessel to vessel,
Nor has he gone into exile.
Therefore he retains his flavor,
And his aroma has not changed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will send to him those who tip vessels, and they will tip him over, and they will empty his vessels and shatter his jars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, as the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘We are mighty warriors,
And men valiant for battle’?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The disaster of Moab will soon come,
And his calamity has swiftly hastened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Mourn for him, all you who live around him,
Even all of you who know his name;
Say, ‘How has the mighty scepter been broken,
A staff of splendor!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come down from your glory
And sit on the parched ground,
O daughter dwelling in Dibon,
For the destroyer of Moab has come up against you,
He has ruined your strongholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stand by the road and keep watch,
O inhabitant of Aroer;
Ask him who flees and her who escapes
And say, ‘What has happened?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab has been put to shame, for it has been shattered.
Wail and cry out;
Declare by the Arnon
That Moab has been destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Judgment has also come upon the plain, upon Holon, Jahzah and against Mephaath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: against Dibon, Nebo and Beth-diblathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: against Kiriathaim, Beth-gamul and Beth-meon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: against Kerioth, Bozrah and all the cities of the land of Moab, far and near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horn of Moab has been cut off and his arm broken,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make him drunk, for he has become arrogant toward the Lord; so Moab will wallow in his vomit, and he also will become a laughingstock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now was not Israel a laughingstock to you? Or was he caught among thieves? For each time you speak about him you shake your head in scorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Leave the cities and dwell among the crags,
O inhabitants of Moab,
And be like a dove that nests
Beyond the mouth of the chasm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We have heard of the pride of Moab—he is very proud—
Of his haughtiness, his pride, his arrogance and his self-exaltation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“More than the weeping for Jazer
I will weep for you, O vine of Sibmah!
Your tendrils stretched across the sea,
They reached to the sea of Jazer;
Upon your summer fruits and your grape harvest
The destroyer has fallen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So gladness and joy are taken away
From the fruitful field, even from the land of Moab.
And I have made the wine to cease from the wine presses;
No one will tread them with shouting,
The shouting will not be shouts of joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the outcry at Heshbon even to Elealeh, even to Jahaz they have raised their voice, from Zoar even to Horonaim and to Eglath-shelishiyah; for even the waters of Nimrim will become desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make an end of Moab,” declares the Lord, “the one who offers sacrifice on the high place and the one who burns incense to his gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore My heart wails for Moab like flutes; My heart also wails like flutes for the men of Kir-heres. Therefore they have lost the abundance it produced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every head is bald and every beard cut short; there are gashes on all the hands and sackcloth on the loins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On all the housetops of Moab and in its streets there is lamentation everywhere; for I have broken Moab like an undesirable vessel,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How shattered it is! How they have wailed! How Moab has turned his back—he is ashamed! So Moab will become a laughingstock and an object of terror to all around him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“Behold, one will fly swiftly like an eagle
And spread out his wings against Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Kerioth has been captured
And the strongholds have been seized,
So the hearts of the mighty men of Moab in that day
Will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Moab will be destroyed from being a people
Because he has become arrogant toward the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Terror, pit and snare are coming upon you,
O inhabitant of Moab,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The one who flees from the terror
Will fall into the pit,
And the one who climbs up out of the pit
Will be caught in the snare;
For I shall bring upon her, even upon Moab,
The year of their punishment,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“In the shadow of Heshbon
The fugitives stand without strength;
For a fire has gone forth from Heshbon
And a flame from the midst of Sihon,
And it has devoured the forehead of Moab
And the scalps of the riotous revelers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to you, Moab!
The people of Chemosh have perished;
For your sons have been taken away captive
And your daughters into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet I will restore the fortunes of Moab
In the latter days,” declares the Lord.
Thus far the judgment on Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning the sons of Ammon. Thus says the Lord:
“Does Israel have no sons?
Or has he no heirs?
Why then has Malcam taken possession of Gad
And his people settled in its cities?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord,
“That I will cause a trumpet blast of war to be heard
Against Rabbah of the sons of Ammon;
And it will become a desolate heap,
And her towns will be set on fire.
Then Israel will take possession of his possessors,”
Says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai has been destroyed!
Cry out, O daughters of Rabbah,
Gird yourselves with sackcloth and lament,
And rush back and forth inside the walls;
For Malcam will go into exile
Together with his priests and his princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How boastful you are about the valleys!
Your valley is flowing away,
O backsliding daughter
Who trusts in her treasures, saying,
‘Who will come against me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am going to bring terror upon you,”
Declares the Lord God of hosts,
“From all directions around you;
And each of you will be driven out headlong,
With no one to gather the fugitives together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But afterward I will restore
The fortunes of the sons of Ammon,”
Declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning Edom.
Thus says the Lord of hosts,
“Is there no longer any wisdom in Teman?
Has good counsel been lost to the prudent?
Has their wisdom decayed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Flee away, turn back, dwell in the depths,
O inhabitants of Dedan,
For I will bring the disaster of Esau upon him
At the time I punish him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If grape gatherers came to you,
Would they not leave gleanings?
If thieves came by night,
They would destroy only until they had enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I have stripped Esau bare,
I have uncovered his hiding places
So that he will not be able to conceal himself;
His offspring has been destroyed along with his relatives
And his neighbors, and he is no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Leave your orphans behind, I will keep them alive;
And let your widows trust in Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, “Behold, those who were not sentenced to drink the cup will certainly drink it, and are you the one who will be completely acquitted? You will not be acquitted, but you will certainly drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have sworn by Myself,” declares the Lord, “that Bozrah will become an object of horror, a reproach, a ruin and a curse; and all its cities will become perpetual ruins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard a message from the Lord,
And an envoy is sent among the nations, saying,
“Gather yourselves together and come against her,
And rise up for battle!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For behold, I have made you small among the nations,
Despised among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As for the terror of you,
The arrogance of your heart has deceived you,
O you who live in the clefts of the rock,
Who occupy the height of the hill.
Though you make your nest as high as an eagle’s,
I will bring you down from there,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Edom will become an object of horror; everyone who passes by it will be horrified and will hiss at all its wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah with its neighbors,” says the Lord, “no one will live there, nor will a son of man reside in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, one will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan against a perennially watered pasture; for in an instant I will make him run away from it, and whoever is chosen I shall appoint over it. For who is like Me, and who will summon Me into court? And who then is the shepherd who can stand against Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear the plan of the Lord which He has planned against Edom, and His purposes which He has purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: surely they will drag them off, even the little ones of the flock; surely He will make their pasture desolate because of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth has quaked at the noise of their downfall. There is an outcry! The noise of it has been heard at the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, He will mount up and swoop like an eagle and spread out His wings against Bozrah; and the hearts of the mighty men of Edom in that day will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning Damascus.
“Hamath and Arpad are put to shame,
For they have heard bad news;
They are disheartened.
There is anxiety by the sea,
It cannot be calmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“How the city of praise has not been deserted,
The town of My joy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, her young men will fall in her streets,
And all the men of war will be silenced in that day,” declares the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will set fire to the wall of Damascus,
And it will devour the fortified towers of Ben-hadad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated. Thus says the Lord,
“Arise, go up to Kedar
And devastate the men of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They will take away their tents and their flocks;
They will carry off for themselves
Their tent curtains, all their goods and their camels,
And they will call out to one another, ‘Terror on every side!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Run away, flee! Dwell in the depths,
O inhabitants of Hazor,” declares the Lord;
“For Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has formed a plan against you
And devised a scheme against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Arise, go up against a nation which is at ease,
Which lives securely,” declares the Lord.
“It has no gates or bars;
They dwell alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Their camels will become plunder,
And their many cattle for booty,
And I will scatter to all the winds those who cut the corners of their hair;
And I will bring their disaster from every side,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hazor will become a haunt of jackals,
A desolation forever;
No one will live there,
Nor will a son of man reside in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That which came as the word of the Lord to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord of hosts,
‘Behold, I am going to break the bow of Elam,
The finest of their might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘I will bring upon Elam the four winds
From the four ends of heaven,
And will scatter them to all these winds;
And there will be no nation
To which the outcasts of Elam will not go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘So I will shatter Elam before their enemies
And before those who seek their lives;
And I will bring calamity upon them,
Even My fierce anger,’ declares the Lord,
‘And I will send out the sword after them
Until I have consumed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Then I will set My throne in Elam
And destroy out of it king and princes,’
Declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘But it will come about in the last days
That I will restore the fortunes of Elam,’”
Declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word which the Lord spoke concerning Babylon, the land of the Chaldeans, through Jeremiah the prophet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Declare and proclaim among the nations.
Proclaim it and lift up a standard.
Do not conceal it but say,
‘Babylon has been captured,
Bel has been put to shame, Marduk has been shattered;
Her images have been put to shame, her idols have been shattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a nation has come up against her out of the north; it will make her land an object of horror, and there will be no inhabitant in it. Both man and beast have wandered off, they have gone away!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In those days and at that time,” declares the Lord, “the sons of Israel will come, both they and the sons of Judah as well; they will go along weeping as they go, and it will be the Lord their God they will seek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will ask for the way to Zion, turning their faces in its direction; they will come that they may join themselves to the Lord in an everlasting covenant that will not be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“All who came upon them have devoured them;
And their adversaries have said, ‘We are not guilty,
Inasmuch as they have sinned against the Lord who is the habitation of righteousness,
Even the Lord, the hope of their fathers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“For behold, I am going to arouse and bring up against Babylon
A horde of great nations from the land of the north,
And they will draw up their battle lines against her;
From there she will be taken captive.
Their arrows will be like an expert warrior
Who does not return empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Chaldea will become plunder;
All who plunder her will have enough,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because you are glad, because you are jubilant,
O you who pillage My heritage,
Because you skip about like a threshing heifer
And neigh like stallions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your mother will be greatly ashamed,
She who gave you birth will be humiliated.
Behold, she will be the least of the nations,
A wilderness, a parched land and a desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because of the indignation of the Lord she will not be inhabited,
But she will be completely desolate;
Everyone who passes by Babylon will be horrified
And will hiss because of all her wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Draw up your battle lines against Babylon on every side,
All you who bend the bow;
Shoot at her, do not be sparing with your arrows,
For she has sinned against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Raise your battle cry against her on every side!
She has given herself up, her pillars have fallen,
Her walls have been torn down.
For this is the vengeance of the Lord:
Take vengeance on her;
As she has done to others, so do to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Cut off the sower from Babylon
And the one who wields the sickle at the time of harvest;
From before the sword of the oppressor
They will each turn back to his own people
And they will each flee to his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Israel is a scattered flock, the lions have driven them away. The first one who devoured him was the king of Assyria, and this last one who has broken his bones is Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: ‘Behold, I am going to punish the king of Babylon and his land, just as I punished the king of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring Israel back to his pasture and he will graze on Carmel and Bashan, and his desire will be satisfied in the hill country of Ephraim and Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days and at that time,’ declares the Lord, ‘search will be made for the iniquity of Israel, but there will be none; and for the sins of Judah, but they will not be found; for I will pardon those whom I leave as a remnant.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Against the land of Merathaim, go up against it,
And against the inhabitants of Pekod.
Slay and utterly destroy them,” declares the Lord,
“And do according to all that I have commanded you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The noise of battle is in the land,
And great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How the hammer of the whole earth
Has been cut off and broken!
How Babylon has become
An object of horror among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I set a snare for you and you were also caught, O Babylon,
While you yourself were not aware;
You have been found and also seized
Because you have engaged in conflict with the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has opened His armory
And has brought forth the weapons of His indignation,
For it is a work of the Lord God of hosts
In the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come to her from the farthest border;
Open up her barns,
Pile her up like heaps
And utterly destroy her,
Let nothing be left to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put all her young bulls to the sword;
Let them go down to the slaughter!
Woe be upon them, for their day has come,
The time of their punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a sound of fugitives and refugees from the land of Babylon,
To declare in Zion the vengeance of the Lord our God,
Vengeance for His temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Summon many against Babylon,
All those who bend the bow:
Encamp against her on every side,
Let there be no escape.
Repay her according to her work;
According to all that she has done, so do to her;
For she has become arrogant against the Lord,
Against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore her young men will fall in her streets,
And all her men of war will be silenced in that day,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, O arrogant one,”
Declares the Lord God of hosts,
“For your day has come,
The time when I will punish you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The arrogant one will stumble and fall
With no one to raise him up;
And I will set fire to his cities
And it will devour all his environs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts,
“The sons of Israel are oppressed,
And the sons of Judah as well;
And all who took them captive have held them fast,
They have refused to let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Their Redeemer is strong, the Lord of hosts is His name;
He will vigorously plead their case
So that He may bring rest to the earth,
But turmoil to the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A sword against the Chaldeans,” declares the Lord,
“And against the inhabitants of Babylon
And against her officials and her wise men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A sword against the oracle priests, and they will become fools!
A sword against her mighty men, and they will be shattered!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A sword against their horses and against their chariots
And against all the foreigners who are in the midst of her,
And they will become women!
A sword against her treasures, and they will be plundered!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“A drought on her waters, and they will be dried up!
For it is a land of idols,
And they are mad over fearsome idols.
