verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore the desert creatures will live there along with the jackals;
The ostriches also will live in it,
And it will never again be inhabited
Or dwelt in from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As when God overthrew Sodom
And Gomorrah with its neighbors,” declares the Lord,
“No man will live there,
Nor will any son of man reside in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, a people is coming from the north,
And a great nation and many kings
Will be aroused from the remote parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“The king of Babylon has heard the report about them,
And his hands hang limp;
Distress has gripped him,
Agony like a woman in childbirth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, one will come up like a lion from the thicket of the Jordan to a perennially watered pasture; for in an instant I will make them run away from it, and whoever is chosen I will appoint over it. For who is like Me, and who will summon Me into court? And who then is the shepherd who can stand before Me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore hear the plan of the Lord which He has planned against Babylon, and His purposes which He has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: surely they will drag them off, even the little ones of the flock; surely He will make their pasture desolate because of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the shout, “Babylon has been seized!” the earth is shaken, and an outcry is heard among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Behold, I am going to arouse against Babylon
And against the inhabitants of Leb-kamai
The spirit of a destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will dispatch foreigners to Babylon that they may winnow her
And may devastate her land;
For on every side they will be opposed to her
In the day of her calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“They will fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans,
And pierced through in their streets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For neither Israel nor Judah has been forsaken
By his God, the Lord of hosts,
Although their land is full of guilt
Before the Holy One of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee from the midst of Babylon,
And each of you save his life!
Do not be destroyed in her punishment,
For this is the Lord’s time of vengeance;
He is going to render recompense to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Babylon has been a golden cup in the hand of the Lord,
Intoxicating all the earth.
The nations have drunk of her wine;
Therefore the nations are going mad.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
We applied healing to Babylon, but she was not healed;
Forsake her and let us each go to his own country,
For her judgment has reached to heaven
And towers up to the very skies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Sharpen the arrows, fill the quivers!
The Lord has aroused the spirit of the kings of the Medes,
Because His purpose is against Babylon to destroy it;
For it is the vengeance of the Lord, vengeance for His temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up a signal against the walls of Babylon;
Post a strong guard,
Station sentries,
Place men in ambush!
For the Lord has both purposed and performed
What He spoke concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you who dwell by many waters,
Abundant in treasures,
Your end has come,
The measure of your end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord of hosts has sworn by Himself:
“Surely I will fill you with a population like locusts,
And they will cry out with shouts of victory over you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is He who made the earth by His power,
Who established the world by His wisdom,
And by His understanding He stretched out the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He utters His voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens,
And He causes the clouds to ascend from the end of the earth;
He makes lightning for the rain
And brings forth the wind from His storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All mankind is stupid, devoid of knowledge;
Every goldsmith is put to shame by his idols,
For his molten images are deceitful,
And there is no breath in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are worthless, a work of mockery;
In the time of their punishment they will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“With you I shatter the horse and his rider,
And with you I shatter the chariot and its rider,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And with you I shatter man and woman,
And with you I shatter old man and youth,
And with you I shatter young man and virgin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And with you I shatter the shepherd and his flock,
And with you I shatter the farmer and his team,
And with you I shatter governors and prefects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I will repay Babylon and all the inhabitants of Chaldea for all their evil that they have done in Zion before your eyes,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, O destroying mountain,
Who destroys the whole earth,” declares the Lord,
“And I will stretch out My hand against you,
And roll you down from the crags,
And I will make you a burnt out mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They will not take from you even a stone for a corner
Nor a stone for foundations,
But you will be desolate forever,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up a signal in the land,
Blow a trumpet among the nations!
Consecrate the nations against her,
Summon against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni and Ashkenaz;
Appoint a marshal against her,
Bring up the horses like bristly locusts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consecrate the nations against her,
The kings of the Medes,
Their governors and all their prefects,
And every land of their dominion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the land quakes and writhes,
For the purposes of the Lord against Babylon stand,
To make the land of Babylon
A desolation without inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
One courier runs to meet another,
And one messenger to meet another,
To tell the king of Babylon
That his city has been captured from end to end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fords also have been seized,
And they have burned the marshes with fire,
And the men of war are terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel:
“The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor
At the time it is stamped firm;
Yet in a little while the time of harvest will come for her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“May the violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon,”
The inhabitant of Zion will say;
And, “May my blood be upon the inhabitants of Chaldea,”
Jerusalem will say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord,
“Behold, I am going to plead your case
And exact full vengeance for you;
And I will dry up her sea
And make her fountain dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Babylon will become a heap of ruins, a haunt of jackals,
An object of horror and hissing, without inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They will roar together like young lions,
They will growl like lions’ cubs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When they become heated up, I will serve them their banquet
And make them drunk, that they may become jubilant
And may sleep a perpetual sleep
And not wake up,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter,
Like rams together with male goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How Sheshak has been captured,
And the praise of the whole earth been seized!
How Babylon has become an object of horror among the nations!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The sea has come up over Babylon;
She has been engulfed with its tumultuous waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Her cities have become an object of horror,
A parched land and a desert,
A land in which no man lives
And through which no son of man passes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will punish Bel in Babylon,
And I will make what he has swallowed come out of his mouth;
And the nations will no longer stream to him.
Even the wall of Babylon has fallen down!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come forth from her midst, My people,
And each of you save yourselves
From the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now so that your heart does not grow faint,
And you are not afraid at the report that will be heard in the land—
For the report will come one year,
And after that another report in another year,
And violence will be in the land
With ruler against ruler—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore behold, days are coming
When I will punish the idols of Babylon;
And her whole land will be put to shame
And all her slain will fall in her midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then heaven and earth and all that is in them
Will shout for joy over Babylon,
For the destroyers will come to her from the north,”
Declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Indeed Babylon is to fall for the slain of Israel,
As also for Babylon the slain of all the earth have fallen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You who have escaped the sword,
Depart! Do not stay!
Remember the Lord from afar,
And let Jerusalem come to your mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We are ashamed because we have heard reproach;
Disgrace has covered our faces,
For aliens have entered
The holy places of the Lord’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore behold, the days are coming,” declares the Lord,
“When I will punish her idols,
And the mortally wounded will groan throughout her land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Though Babylon should ascend to the heavens,
And though she should fortify her lofty stronghold,
From Me destroyers will come to her,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of an outcry from Babylon,
And of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord is going to destroy Babylon,
And He will make her loud noise vanish from her.
And their waves will roar like many waters;
The tumult of their voices sounds forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the destroyer is coming against her, against Babylon,
And her mighty men will be captured,
Their bows are shattered;
For the Lord is a God of recompense,
He will fully repay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will make her princes and her wise men drunk,
Her governors, her prefects and her mighty men,
That they may sleep a perpetual sleep and not wake up,”
Declares the King, whose name is the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts,
“The broad wall of Babylon will be completely razed
And her high gates will be set on fire;
So the peoples will toil for nothing,
And the nations become exhausted only for fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The message which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the grandson of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. (Now Seraiah was quartermaster.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jeremiah wrote in a single scroll all the calamity which would come upon Babylon, that is, all these words which have been written concerning Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to Seraiah, “As soon as you come to Babylon, then see that you read all these words aloud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘You, O Lord, have promised concerning this place to cut it off, so that there will be nothing dwelling in it, whether man or beast, but it will be a perpetual desolation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as soon as you finish reading this scroll, you will tie a stone to it and throw it into the middle of the Euphrates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Just so shall Babylon sink down and not rise again because of the calamity that I am going to bring upon her; and they will become exhausted.’” Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem; and his mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did evil in the sight of the Lord like all that Jehoiakim had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For through the anger of the Lord this came about in Jerusalem and Judah until He cast them out from His presence. And Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about in the ninth year of his reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, camped against it and built a siege wall all around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the city was under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the ninth day of the fourth month the famine was so severe in the city that there was no food for the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the city was broken into, and all the men of war fled and went forth from the city at night by way of the gate between the two walls which was by the king’s garden, though the Chaldeans were all around the city. And they went by way of the Arabah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho, and all his army was scattered from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they captured the king and brought him up to the king of Babylon at Riblah in the land of Hamath, and he passed sentence on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king of Babylon slaughtered the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and he also slaughtered all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he blinded the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him with bronze fetters and brought him to Babylon and put him in prison until the day of his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now on the tenth day of the fifth month, which was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the bodyguard, who was in the service of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He burned the house of the Lord, the king’s house and all the houses of Jerusalem; even every large house he burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the army of the Chaldeans who were with the captain of the guard broke down all the walls around Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away into exile some of the poorest of the people, the rest of the people who were left in the city, the deserters who had deserted to the king of Babylon and the rest of the artisans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left some of the poorest of the land to be vinedressers and plowmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the bronze pillars which belonged to the house of the Lord and the stands and the bronze sea, which were in the house of the Lord, the Chaldeans broke in pieces and carried all their bronze to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also took away the pots, the shovels, the snuffers, the basins, the pans and all the bronze vessels which were used in temple service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The captain of the guard also took away the bowls, the firepans, the basins, the pots, the lampstands, the pans and the drink offering bowls, what was fine gold and what was fine silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two pillars, the one sea, and the twelve bronze bulls that were under the sea, and the stands, which King Solomon had made for the house of the Lord—the bronze of all these vessels was beyond weight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the pillars, the height of each pillar was eighteen cubits, and it was twelve cubits in circumference and four fingers in thickness, and hollow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a capital of bronze was on it; and the height of each capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the capital all around, all of bronze. And the second pillar was like these, including pomegranates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were ninety-six exposed pomegranates; all the pomegranates numbered a hundred on the network all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest and Zephaniah the second priest, with the three officers of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also took from the city one official who was overseer of the men of war, and seven of the king’s advisers who were found in the city, and the scribe of the commander of the army who mustered the people of the land, and sixty men of the people of the land who were found in the midst of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was led away into exile from its land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away into exile: in the seventh year 3,023 Jews;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar 832 persons from Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried into exile 745 Jewish people; there were 4,600 persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, showed favor to Jehoiachin king of Judah and brought him out of prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he spoke kindly to him and set his throne above the thrones of the kings who were with him in Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehoiachin changed his prison clothes, and had his meals in the king’s presence regularly all the days of his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For his allowance, a regular allowance was given him by the king of Babylon, a daily portion all the days of his life until the day of his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator
